content: g u l f o f m e x i c o 2 0 2 6 © k i e r a n f o l e y 2 0 2 6 the nets were overflowing in the gulf of mexico an updated version of my 2025 gulf of mexico scarf inspired by refuge of the roads by joni mitchell this version has an i-cord edging knit on 5mm/us8 needles with approximately 60g/280yds/260m of leftover lengths of schoppel wolle zauberball crazy colorways include change of scenery dark roses cool botanical garden and late autumn the scarf is worked with two strands held together if you are working with one strand of a heavier yarn allow approximately 140yds/130m dimensions approximately 4ins/10 5cm wide by 43 5ins/110cm gauge approximately 18sts measured on the diagonal and 28 row measured along the spine = 4ins/10cm notes the scarf begins with a few stitches created with the backwards loop cast on only one of the stitches is used the others are left to unravel one backwards loop stitch on its own is a bit unstable - the extra stitches hold it in place and make it easier to work the 1 - 7 stitch increase after a few row the initial loop can be pulled tight for a neat point if you are not familiar with this cast on method here is a link to a video https //www kieranfoley com/knit_lab_video_tutorials html #backwards_loop_cast_on the double increase abbreviated to increase is worked as follows k yo k into one stitch increasing by two stitches it is worked as follows insert the right hand needle into the next stitch and knit a stitch but don t drop the original stitch from the left hand needle make a yarn over insert the right hand needle back into the stitch and knit again this time dropping the original stitch off the left hand needle the 1 - 5 stitch increase is made with the same method keeping the original stitch on the left hand needle while you work k yo k yo k into it the 1 - 7 stitch increase is made with the same method working k yo k yo k yo k into the original stitch on the left hand needle sl3wyif means slip three stitches with the yarn in front bring the yarn to the front between the needles and slip the 3 remaining stitches from the left hand needle to the right hand needle kfb means knit into the front and back of the stitch - increasing by one stitch the centered double decrease cdd at the end of the project is worked as follows slip two stitches together as if to knit them together knit the next stitch pass the two slipped stitches over the knitted stitch the pattern can also be worked in a more varied palette to use up any scraps you have hanging around keep the knitting quite loose for a soft flexible fabric i spliced yarn ends at color
